intro: Rhytiglossa anagallis, commonly known as the silverleaf morning glory, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its striking silver-green leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped blue or purple flowers that bloom in the morning. The plant belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is known for its rapid growth and climbing habit. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens but can become invasive if not managed properly.
